p: Although the nitrogen intake was similar between treatments, a decrease of 14.66% ( p < 0.05) was noticed in TNO in the LEW group compared to the SM group. The dietary addition of extruded linseed and walnut meal led to a high reduction of the nitrogen level in urine (1.31 times, p < 0.01) and in calculated NAB (1.04 times, p < 0.05). Calculated BVFP was 14.8% higher ( p < 0.05) in the LEW group compared to the SM group. In addition, an increase of NPU ( p > 0.05) in the LEW group compared to the SM group was not obtained. Dietary treatments did not affect CTTAD or CAM ( p > 0.05).
